intro.title: Hello Javascript
intro.description: Variables local and global, Strings and Numbers. Variables are global by default in JavaScript, and there is a single global namespace. Here we look at the issues this can cause and how to avoid them.

functions.title: Functions
functions.description: Functions are first class objects in JavaScript, here we look at what this means for you.

closure.title: Closure and Variable Scope
closure.description: Local variables belong to a special hidden object called scope. This object can persist, even after their function has exited.

arrays.title: Arrays and loops
arrays.description: JavaScript has both classical loops and functional loops. Lets take a look.

jquery.title: Manipulating the DOM with JQuery
jquery.description: In which we investigate the power of JQuery to change your DOM.

events.title: JQuery Events
events.description: JavaScript is event driven, it reacts to user events, network events, page load events, etc. We assign callback functions to events. These are called when the event is fired.

json.title: JSON
json.description: In JavaScript, all objects are arrays. JSON syntax allows us to create objects quickly and easily.

object-orientation.title: Object Orientation
object-orientation.description: JavaScript is class free so any function can act as a constructor.

meaning-of-this.title: Meaning of This
meaning-of-this.description: JavaScript has a special variable called this. This is set at runtime..

ajax.title: AJAX
ajax.description: We can pull code directly from our server using AJAX.

lodash-templates.title: Lodash Templates
lodash-templates.description: Templates help us keep out HTML where it belongs: in the HTML.

promises.title: Promises
promises.description: Promises help us manage asynchronous events.
